Job Title: Material Controller LIC 3

Location: Charleston, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Aufgaben

Shape the future today.

The world is changing. The question is, what will be our contribution to the outcome? We have set the pace in the field of mobility from the very beginning, and we will continue to do so. At Mercedes-Benz Vans, interdisciplinary teams are developing the mobility of tomorrow. Our goal is to make mobility safer, simpler, and more sustainable for people across the globe. Put your pioneering spirit to good use: This is your opportunity to make a contribution that extends far beyond your job title.

At Mercedes-Benz Vans, we offer you the perfect environment for your professional and personal growth. Cutting-edge training and promising career opportunities will help you to foster and expand your professional skill set as well as your individual strengths. Think, try, and thrive with us in collaborative work environments that spark game-changing concepts.

Job Overview:

Analysis of part delivery process, material flow, troubleshooting, and KPI analysis. Coordinate the documentation of production parts (new/changed) in logistic systems and ensuring that those parts are available to secure production. Monitor LSP (Logistic Service Provider) in system warehouse setup, hot part analysis, and deviations to the process.

Responsibilities:

Check documentation from development/documentation department for completeness and ensure that missing components (drawings, bill of material, etc.) are being provided in a timely fashion Monitor, input, and track KPIs for shop floor management system (SFM)Develops processes, procedures and support training to ensure inventory and ERP program are consistentHandle complex issues which caused interruption in production or over deliveries by performing root cause analysis when applicable, including the analyze/control of the inventory levelIdentifying release data for production parts with complex associations incl. the documentation of point of use, unloading point, usage, material planer index, etcParticipates in regularly scheduled team meetingsProvides feedback to management on accuracy levels, procedure problems, and recommends corrective actionsSupport the implementation of logistical systems pertaining to material and information flow in the warehouse, in the supermarket and in the line under consideration of the overall concept identify opportunities for optimizationTo maintain a high degree of integrity and fairness in transactions with suppliers / logistics service providerWill perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifikationen

Bachelor's degree in Logistics or in a related Engineering field required, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

A minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience in the field of automotive operations, supply chain management, procurement or Logistics.

Knowledge & Skills:

Specific areas of interest are logistics, order management, shop floor management and supplier management.

Knowledge of the product and parts. Ability to work during scheduled work hours, as well as overtime, including weekends.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate with all levels of management.

Highly motivated self-starter; Team oriented; outstanding planning and proactive skills.

We are all in for change. Are you too? Apply now.

If you have experience in the above and are interested in joining an outstanding company we welcome you to apply. The division Mercedes-Benz Vans is world renown for quality and innovative products.

EXCELLENT COMPENSATION & BENEFITS PLAN WITH 401k MATCHING
